frontmatter.title: Construct a record
frontmatter.description: Follow the steps below to construct a record using the Statement Editor.
frontmatter.keywords: ballerina, vs code extension, record construction, statement editor
frontmatter.intro: Follow the steps below to construct a record using the Statement Editor.

pageProps.content: 1. Navigate to the Record Editor and select **Create New**. 2. Double-click the default record name to change it. 3. To add another field to the record, click the **plus** button, which appears when you hover over the current field. 4. To convert the record field to a default-valued field, click the **semicolon(;)**. >**Info:** This selects the complete record field and selects the **Expressions** tab. 5. Click the **Es=Ex** template. >**Info:** The selected field gets updated with the **``** template. You can double-click and update it. 6. Follow either of the two approaches below to mark a record field as **Optional**. First, select the variable name of the field that is needed to mark as optional, and then, 1. select the **?** from the toolbar 2. select the **Es?** template from the **Expressions** tab 7. To convert the record to an open/closed record, select the complete record by clicking on the record keyword. >**Info:** This selects the **Expressions** tab, which gives the option to make a record a closed record. 8. Once the record field configuration is done, click **Save**.
